metadata.title: CVE-2015-8552 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The PCI backend driver in Xen, when running on an x86 system and usingLinux 3.1.x through 4.3.x as the driver domain, allows local guestadministrators to generate a continuous stream of WARN messages and cause adenial of service (disk consumption) by leveraging a system with access toa passed-through MSI or MSI-X capable physical PCI device andXEN_PCI_OP_enable_msi operations, aka "Linux pciback missing sanitychecks."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
